page.title: 09Hopes & fears, Ousden
page.content: Most people are concerned with the wider issues of today, especially the threat of nuclear war. There is also a general concern about the problem of drug abuse, and they worry lest their own youngsters are offered drugs. There is also a growing concern about the increase in violence and may people especially the elderly fear burglary. The nearness of High Point Prison aggravates this feeling of insecurity. At a more personal and village level, most people hope the village will remain the peaceful rural place it now is. There is a general interest in conserving the countryside and the appearance of the houses, ie, rethatching the cottages instead of replacing by tiles or slate. Yet again some would like improved street lighting & others are frustrated by restrictions on housing and renovation
